newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: U.S. rate decision fails to boost Manila shares.
newsitem.headline: U.S. rate decision fails to boost Manila shares.

text.p: Philippine shares closed lower on Wednesday with investors failing to find inspiration in the U.S. decision not to raise interest rates, traders said.
"The market has probably discounted the rate issue," Joey Roxas, president of Eagle Securities, said.
The Philippine Stock Exchange Index closed weaker by 1.44 points, or 0.04 percent, at 3,235.04.
The market closed mixed as advancers outnumbered decliners 67 to 49 with 70 unchanged issues.
"There was lack of interest in most commercial issues and the focus remained on the speculative stocks," said Teresa Lee, trader at Lippo Securities.
The listing of Music Semiconductors Corp on Thursday is expected to usher in liquidity, traders said.
